# Question 3 (Cluster Analysis)

## a)

```{r}
cluster_scatter_plot <- function(clusters, plot_title, plot_number){
  cluster_data <- data.frame(
  x = data2[, 1],  
  y = data2[, 2],  
  cluster = as.factor(clusters)
  )
  
  cp <- ggplot(cluster_data, aes(x = x, y = y, color = cluster)) +
    geom_point(size = 1, alpha = 0.7) +
    scale_color_viridis_d(option = "C") +  
    labs(
      title = plot_title,
      x = "Variable 1",
      y = "Variable 2",
      color = "Cluster"
    ) +        
    theme_minimal() +
    theme(
      plot.title = element_text(size = 17.5, face = "bold"),  
      axis.title.x = element_text(size = 14),               
      axis.title.y = element_text(size = 14),               
      axis.text = element_text(size = 10),                  
      plot.margin = margin(0.5, 0.5, 0.5, 0.5, "cm"),     
      panel.grid.minor = element_blank()                    
    )
  
  ggsave(cp, filename = paste0("Plots/Question 3a K-Means Scatter Plot ", plot_number,".png"))
  return(cp)
}
```

```{r}
set.seed(123)

# Cluster Plot 1 
km_result <- kmeans(data2, centers = 15, nstart = 10) 
cluster_scatter_plot(km_result$cluster, "K-Means Clustering (k=15)", 1)

# Cluster Plot 2
km_result <- kmeans(data2, centers = 16, nstart = 10) 
cluster_scatter_plot(km_result$cluster, "K-Means Clustering (k=16)", 2)

# Cluster Plot 3
pam_result <- pam(data2, k = 15) 
cluster_scatter_plot(pam_result$cluster, "K-Medoids Clustering (k=15)", 3)

# Cluster Plot 4
pam_result <- pam(data2, k = 16) 
cluster_scatter_plot(pam_result$cluster, "K-Medoids Clustering (k=16)", 4)
```
